messages: 8c743c01ddd7df4bde8edc3331015886 (17:56): Hello, in HTML5 Canvas can use/draw HTML Form's? something like Button, Text input, Submit, etc.

70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:16): So, while I was gone did you guys make many changes to base css?
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (18:16): cant think of anything ground breaking.

70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:18): Last night a guy out here asked me about jQ touch and as a response I showed him a yayQuery episode with John Resig introducing the show while singing the yayQuery theme song.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:19): as a result, he learned a few things.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:19): As a result, he now also wants to do podcasts :)
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:20): Yea, there's a lot of yayQuery love out there.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:21): I was expecting the yayQuery podcast to be in Spanish."
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:22): My girlfriend could translate fo sho.
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (18:22): yes why dont you all speak in spanish?
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:22): Just don't be alarmed when you're listening to the translation and you hear things like "El Diablo Robotico"
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:22): You're like "What did I say that translates to that... huh. Oh well, must be right."
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:25): I'm really bummed more hasn't been done @ https://github.com/paulirish/html5-boilerplate/wiki/Reference-Sheet-for-Mobile-Platforms
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:25): i'm not sure if shichaun kept workin in his sheet
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:29): I haven't been thrilled with the css skin libraries for mobile either.
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (18:34): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: I'm assuming that all the unresolved tickets at lazyweb-requests still need people to work on them/help?

70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:39): I wasn't able to create smooth scrolling, but I had something, and it looked right in IE and Firefox, so even if they weren't the "target" market, they made it easier to develop on.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:43): I was going to build a simple score keeper app for card games, since all the free ones REALLY sucked.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:43): Couldn't play a sensable game of Gin Rummy, I tell ya.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:44): haha i forgot how to play :(
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (18:52): wow it even has the little bits of graphite dust float off as you draw
8e9a5ab9acb0d38c096cb0f02406514e (18:52): that really caused my Firefox to work hard... :)
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (18:53): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: yeah, been reading through all the tickets
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:54): i have a new idea that i think is amazing
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:54): click.. select one chunk of text.. select another
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:54): and get a big beautiful dif
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (18:55): hmm now I'm torn between that and the mailing list beautifier
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (18:56): well less of a beautifier than permalink support
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:57): someone here started on that a few days ago.. let me find the log.
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (18:57): oh, see good thing I asked
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (19:04): well if you don't mind 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 I'll start cracking away at the extension ^^
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (19:13): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132: i havent yet merged your latest IEPP with modernizr. should i go ahead and do that?
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (19:14): i havent heard reports of this one or the latest
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (19:14): except for the @media bug i reported the other day
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (19:18): I will have to review that media bug.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (19:21): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132: i figure if its not accessible via CSSOM then it might not be fixable, reasonably. :/
76965a2e566826f3ea13d17d543d2233 (19:22): hi. did the value of onsubmit in <form> change from javascript code to a function name?
76965a2e566826f3ea13d17d543d2233 (19:23): i.e. html4 = <form ‚Ä¶ onsubmit="return func();">, html5 = <form ‚Ä¶ onsubmit="func">
76965a2e566826f3ea13d17d543d2233 (19:26): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: bit it only validates the latter
76965a2e566826f3ea13d17d543d2233 (19:27): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: ok, it does not complain about func(), but it complains about return func()
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (19:28): but also the validator doesnt know what its talking about inside those event handlers
76965a2e566826f3ea13d17d543d2233 (19:28): it's not a feature, it's a bug? ;)
14d0a6d6b68e3c33343a1c813af6a4dc (19:30): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 did they add any new print functions to css3/html5 couldn find much about it
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (19:35): This channel should be renamed to paulirishfanclub
